Florida Winefest And Auction Inc - GuideStar Profile Search Update Nonprofit Profile Products Candid insights Support Create account Sign in GuideStar Florida Winefest And Auction Inc Sarasota, FL | www.floridawinefest.org Summary Programs + Results Financials Operations Mission PROVIDE FUNDING TO QUALIFIED  CHARITABLE ORGANIZATIONS FOR PROGRAMS ASSISTING DISADVANTAGED CHILDREN, YOUTH AND FAMILIES IN SARASOTA AND MANATEE COUNTIES. (FLORIDA)
 WE ARE THE FUND-RAISING ARM FOR CHARING FOR CHILDREN CHARITIES. Notes from the nonprofit Florida Winefest & Auction, Inc. is the fund-raising arm for Caring for Children Charities.  

Caring for Children Charities (EIN # 93-3143149) is applying for a 501(c)(3) not-for-profit corporation and the application is in process. Ruling year info 1994 Principal Officer Mrs. Sandra W. Loevner Main address PO Box 4193 Sarasota, FL 34230 USA Show more contact info Contact Information × Contact Email contact available with a Pro subscription Physical Address PO Box 4193 Sarasota, FL 34230 Payment Address PO Box 4193 Sarasota, FL 34230 Donation Payable Legal name of organization: Florida Winefest And Auction Inc Close EIN 65-0455486 NTEE code info Raising & Fund Distribution (Oun) IRS filing requirement This organization is required to file an IRS Form 990 or 990-EZ. Sign in or create an account to view Form(s) 990 for 2023, 2022 and 2021. Register now Communication Is this your nonprofit? Login and update Why claim your profile? Learn about benefits Programs and results What we aim to solve This profile needs more info. If it is your nonprofit, add a problem overview. Login and update Our programs SOURCE: Self-reported by organization What are the organization's current programs, how do they measure success,
            and who do the programs serve? Meaningful Grants to Local Not-for-Profit Organizations Florida Winefest & Auction, Inc.  is a group of dedicated volunteers who organize  first-class fun events to generate funds to help children in need. In the last 33 years, Florida Winefest & Auction has supported over 98 different charitable organizations and  awarding over $9.3 million in charitable grants. Each year grant applications are submitted to the Florida Winefest by qualified not-for-profit charities. The applications are reviewed by the Florida Winefest Grants Committee.  The website www.floridawinefest.org will give dates when applications may be submitted to received funds from upcoming events.  Florida Winefest & Auction is the fund-raising arm of Caring for Children Charities. Population(s) Served Where we work Manatee County, FL Sarasota County, FL Goals & Strategy SOURCE: Self-reported by organization Learn about the organization's key goals, strategies, capabilities, and progress. Charting impact Four powerful questions that require reflection about what really matters - results. What is the organization aiming to accomplish? What are the organization's key strategies for making this happen? Host multiple fund-raising events during the year to benefit local disadvantaged children's charities. Our staff is comprised of volunteers who donate their time to organize hold the events.  We have been hosting events since 1991.  Over $9.3 Million has been donated to 98 individual charities in Manatee & Sarasota Counties.  Events are scheduled for January 2025. What are the organization's capabilities for doing this? What have they accomplished so far and what's next? How we listen SOURCE: Self-reported by organization Seeking feedback from people served  makes programs more responsive and effective. Here’s how this organization is listening. done We shared information about our current feedback practices. How is your organization using feedback from the people you serve? Which of the following feedback practices does your organization routinely carry out? , , , , , What challenges does the organization face when collecting feedback? Board orientation and education Does the board conduct a formal orientation for new board members and require all board members to sign a written agreement regarding their roles, responsibilities, and expectations? No CEO oversight Has the board conducted a formal, written assessment of the chief executive within the past year ? No Ethics and transparency Have the board and senior staff reviewed the conflict-of-interest policy and completed and signed disclosure statements in the past year? No Board composition Does the board ensure an inclusive board member recruitment process that results in diversity of thought and leadership? Contact Us - Southwest Florida Wine and Food Fest Skip to main content Hit enter to search or ESC to close Close Search Menu SWFL Wine & Food Fest SWFL Wine & Food Fest Since 2009, this premier fundraising event has donated over $29 million for three primary beneficiaries: Golisano Children’s Hospital of Southwest Florida, and scholarships for local students majoring in health sciences to Florida Gulf Coast University and Florida SouthWestern State College.
